qas.question: What was Paris known as in Latin?
In what century was Christianity introduced?
What is the name of Saint Denis burial place?

context: By the end of the Western Roman Empire, the town was known simply as <a0_0>Parisius<a0_0/> in Latin and Paris in French. Christianity was introduced in the middle of the <a1_0>3rd<a1_0/> century AD. According to tradition, it was brought by <a2_0>Saint Denis<a2_0/>, the first Bishop of Paris. When he refused to renounce his faith, he was beheaded on the hill which became known as the "<a4_0>Mountain of Martyrs<a4_0/>" (Mons Martyrum), eventually "Montmartre". His burial place became an important religious shrine; the <a3_0>Basilica of Saint-Denis<a3_0/> was built there and became the burial place of the French Kings.
